alert.note: Alert for Chambers (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 7:33PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Chambers County through 800 PM CDT... At 733 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cusseta, or 7 miles north of Opelika, moving north at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lanett, Lafayette, Stroud, La Fayette, Lakeview, Five Points, Cusseta, Post Oak Forks, Denson, Amity Park, Sturkie, Standing Rock, Welch, Buffalo, Chambers County Lake, Fredonia, Veasey Creek Park, Huguley, Oak Bowery and Penton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
